title: Insurance Executive Greg Lindberg Indicted in Bribery Investigation
text:
Greg Lindberg, a North Carolina entrepreneur who lent at least $2 billion from insurers he controlled to his own enterprises, was indicted Tuesday on federal criminal charges of conspiring to bribe the state regulator overseeing his insurers.

The indictment rocked North Carolina’s Republican Party. One of Mr. Lindberg’s three co-defendants in the case is party chairman and former congressman Robert “Robin” Cannon Hayes, who allegedly agreed to direct $250,000 from state party coffers to the state insurance commissioner on...
description: Insurance executive Greg Lindberg, the subject of a February Wall Street Journal article, was indicted on a charge of alleged federal criminal conspiracy to bribe a public official.
